website_summaries.verdict: This gas-powered chipper and shredder does a great job of mulching – just don't let it overfill.
pros: Rolls around easily to different locations
Handles everything from leaves to branches up to 3 inches in diameter
cons: Can clog if too many leaves are fed in at once
Chipper may fling debris back out when collection bag is full

customer_reviews.title: Parts falling off
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the TazzK32 Chipper Shredder in June 2017 and it has seen very little use. One of the first things I noticed was some of the screws had worked loose which was expected with the vibration that occurs while operating the machine. I was a little surprised though when the wheels fell off due to the axle breaking apart. Then the carburetor almost fell off and now the muffler has broken and fallen off. At a total price of $641.99 I would expect something to be better quality than this. I now wish I had spent more and got something that's not useless junk.
customer_reviews.author: Gary W. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Product Damaged and Missing Parts
customer_reviews.text: Missing parts and the chute was bent so that it would not slide onto the bolts. Tried to adjust, but it would not work. Had to return it. Would not buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: B. Handley

customer_reviews.title: Eats trees and leaves...
customer_reviews.text: Just picked this up, but we've been using it pretty heavily on our 3.5 wooded acres. Mulched up several small trees and huge piles of leaves with no issues and a pretty easy learning curve. When using the hopper for leaves and twigs, less is more. Small handfuls will go down quickly and require less stirring with a stick to get them into the shredder's teeth. When using the chute for larger branches, trimming off the bigger offshoot branches helps, but smaller ones will just follow the main one down the chute. Be sure to wear hearing protection, eye-pro and gloves. We're very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: FRED

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I generally do not write reviews, however, this requires a minus one star. First, it appears from the packaging that I recieved already returned parts. I ordered this last July and 6 months into it after 3 uses, and while looking down, I saw the muffler falling off. While I was shredding/chipping, the muffler had torn from the metal and fallen onto the ground!! Not only is this a defective item and a safety issue but the sender obviously packaged already used and returned parts as the holes where the bolts go, were missing the paint and some parts were bent. With that being said, it did work good the first two times using it. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie Radabaugh

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: Worst producer EVER purchased on Amazon. Dangerous. Difficult. Defective. And trying to return is real pain. Parts were missing. Clogged. To return need to drain oil and gas. Disassemble and find a way to send. I even purchased the Square Trade warranty. I have had and used only a few days. Ended up hauling off the limbs myself. Very annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: Terry U.

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't even built to their own specs!
customer_reviews.text: Unit worked great for about 15 hours. Then the bolt that holds the hammer rotor assembly to the engine shaft sheared off. Spec calls for a 3/8-24 x 2 Gr8 bolt, but the installed bolt was a 5/16-24 x2 Gr8. This bolt just snapped off. Local mechanic replace with the same 5/16-24 bolt, lasted about 5 additional hours, snapped again. We live in Belize, so sending it back for repair is not an option, one of the problems living in paradise! I liked the shredder when it worked, now I'm not so sure. Wasn't even built to their own specs!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This might be fine unit if it's not damaged
customer_reviews.text: I've tried ordering two of these. Both came damaged. The first was crunched on the hopper, top corner. The second was an obvious return. the hopper had been removed and the bottom was bent up. This might be fine unit if it's not damaged, unfortunately, I was never able to get far enough to try it. The factory packaging might work on a pallet with a forklift, but isn't enough to ship individually. I'll be looking locally to pickup something.
customer_reviews.author: Bitsmith

customer_reviews.title: Not made for the job
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the first 8 hours used, then it literally fell apart. The muffler was torn off the engine due to poor bracket design, the chipper bag developed a giant hole in the bottem and the plastic around the discharge broke off. It was not designed very well for the job it is suppose to do
customer_reviews.author: D. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Does a fantastic job creating mulch
customer_reviews.text: Machine arrived with a few cosmetic dings from shipping no doubt. Started and runs well. Does a fantastic job creating mulch. Clogs easily with green wet cuttings but otherwise handles everything that fits into the chute with no problem. Would have been nice if a drain was designed into the lower casing (cutter wheel housing) to make cleaning out with hose easier. I prefer not to leave thick cakes of mulch inside because once it dries it is more difficult to remove. I cleaned by opening the vacuum hose port and hosing from all openings. Loosened lower casing screws to allow excess water to drain out.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Mosca

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had read poor reviews on several different chipper/shredders. I can say that this machine has taken everything that I have thrown at it. I feel any bad reviews on this item is probably from people not understanding how these things work. Will it take 3" stock...Sure, but you can't just jam it through, if you hear the shipper slowing down, give it 3 seconds to spin back up. I reduced half a tree to 3 garbage bags. I wouldn't buy this in hopes to reuse the mulch though, it shreds much to small to make it worth using. The only bad thing, is the bag is too small for how fast it works!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Good buy, functions as described.
customer_reviews.text: The little Tazz K32, with 212cc Viper engine chipper/shredder, is a good buy at its price point. The price point, features, and the 5-year warranty is what made me take a chance on a brand that was unknown to me. Happy with this purchase; works as described and as expected. It was easy to assemble and start. One suggestion I have for the manufacturer would be to include a holder for bag support rod when moving or storing. A simple tube or clamp near wheels or handle would suffice. All in all, happy with this purchase and I would recommend to family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Caballero

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. It's quite the workhorse. I've had it about 6 weeks and have used it heavily. It's great for dry or wet leaves, as well as, branches and small lumber. One minor note -- the axle broke after a few weeks. I called the manufacturer and they had a replacement out to me in about 3 days. Great turnaround time. It's nice to know they support their products so well. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: JMM, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Happy but lost 2 stars!
customer_reviews.text: The original packaging is not good. The hopper was damaged. My husband however was able to fix and fit it in the machine. Still doesn't fit perfectly! If you get this chipper read the instruction before using it. I didn't at first and the machine jammed within an hour use. But today I followed the instruction and worked great. If it wasn't because of the damage it would have give it 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki D

customer_reviews.title: quality machine
customer_reviews.text: Assembly took about 1 hour. Have never had any problem getting this to start. Only had one minor issue, the collection bag ripped but it was really my fault because a large screw was in with a pile of leaves and vines that I was shredding without my knowledge. The shredder threw the screw out forcefully and ripped the bag. I'm surprised the machine held up so well because it was a very large screw, only giving credit to how well this thing is built. I can forsee in the future that the plastic lock mechanism on the collection bag may be the flimsiest part of the design.
customer_reviews.author: JDK

customer_reviews.title: Nice Chipper/Shredder. Works well and is a good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. A bit time consuming to put together, in fact there were a few things that could have been assembled at the factory to help the consumer and would not have increased the shipping size. It has done an excellent job and the only other negative are the rather flimsy wheels that don't seem to be adequate for the weight of the machine. I really like the chipper/shredder though and will change out the wheels later on.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Does start up easily. Would return it if I could
customer_reviews.text: Nothing special. Doesn't shred the 3" branches it claimed it would. Does ok but loosens the bolt frequently. Will need to use lock tight on the bolts. Does start up easily. Would return it if I could.
customer_reviews.author: K. Waldron

customer_reviews.title: Neither very well built nor designed.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this a low rating after the muffler just rusted out (it's always kept out of the weather). I had to disassemble the chipper almost entirely to replace it. I have a lot of tools, but not one to get into the nuts securing the muffler. Also, the leaf chute has split away from its flange. I'll have to remove and weld it. It's never been dropped.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Chips and Shreds like a pro.
customer_reviews.text: This is a beast. It will reduce piles of leaves to nothing in a very short time. Mulch from leaves etc. is about the size of your fingernail.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Sires

customer_reviews.title: Good engine; horrible chipper/shredder
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed with this purchase, and I certainly would not recommend it to anyone. I bought this item November 2017 after reading positive reviews. I first put it to work April 2018. After less than 5 hours of total use, the chipper/shredder is inoperable without repair. After about 3 hours of use, I noticed a quarter-sized hole in the so-called "rugged" bag. After less than 5 hours use, it lost two bolts from the shredder housing, and a bolt holding one of the blades was almost completely off and severely bent. Pictures of these items are attached.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Overall good machine
customer_reviews.text: Like the power. Ease of start. Had a whole lot of work to do to put this together though. Some parts (hopper) were bent. Did not happen in shipping. It was at the bottom where it attached to the machine. Had to bend it I to place. Otherwise ran well on first two hour session. Bag attachment is somewhat difficult. Overall good machine so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts
customer_reviews.text: Just received it and it is missing bolts to assemble. Contacted Amazon and will need to go back through the manuf to get the parts. To be Cont...... Contacted Manufacturer and they immediately sent out parts to replace the missing ones. Not sure if it rates a 4 star having to get parts but the manuf did respond quickly. After completing - filled it with oil and gas - it started right up. Grinding away. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Chaukasu

customer_reviews.title: Chomping machine!
customer_reviews.text: Have used this for about 4 hours and nothing came flying off yet. Easy-ish to put together. Starts quite easy for a giant engine and chips like a beaver on angle dust! Anything that fits into the chute will be chipped up fast. The straighter the better though. Chipping angular wood like locust would be a bear. Slick for the yard and saves a lot of wood hauling of branches on our wooded lot.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sleutel-Robinson

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice, compact unit
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, compact unit. The engine starts easily and has very good power. I assembled the unit and began cutting and grinding limbs up to 3" diameter. The machine ate everything I threw at it and ground the limbs into nice sized chips and mulch. I cut oak, cypress, dogwood and it did great. For the money, it is both good value and a nice homeowners tool. Burning here in Tennesse may halt altogether after the Great Gatlinburg fires! This will make the machine invaluable.....shipping was great also.......F
customer_reviews.author: BudHill

customer_reviews.title: Performs well but packaging caused some parts to be bent.
customer_reviews.text: Chipper starts easily and does very good on 2" branches if not too dry. Typically small twigs or long stems if not held are pulled in (either shredder or chipper) without fully shredding (so these may clog output and otherwise have to be re-shredded to get finer chips). My main complaint is that the hopper was shipped unbolted but sitting on top of the mating bolts. This severely bent the hopper flange and I was not able to completely straighten the flange. The damper door was also bent. As result I can't fully tighten flange screws and I must pry the damper door open each time I use the shredder hopper.
customer_reviews.author: PBOlyPen

customer_reviews.title: bent axle, need axle assembly
customer_reviews.text: the unit has a bent axle and it is impossible to install one of the wheels. the unit is to heavy to send back i would like a new axle assembly
customer_reviews.author: M.A. Van Camp

customer_reviews.title: Additional high altitude parts required.
customer_reviews.text: Cannot start the machine until Feb, 2018 because the company is out of the high altitude kit required. The need for this kit is not listed in the ad for the machine and should be. Too hard to make an adjustment on the carb. I suppose. Part listed is $9.00. Wish I had known. The hopper came bent and will try to straighten it out. This seems to be a common problem. Will update next year.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie A. Scott

customer_reviews.title: This chipper is fine as long as you aren't using "green" twigs or ...
customer_reviews.text: This chipper is fine as long as you aren't using "green" twigs or other material, in which case clogging can become an issue, and/or the machine just spits out pieces nearly the same as they entered the chute. Does well with dry wood, leaves, and garden refuse. Is easy to start and use in general, and hauling from location to location in the yard is not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: ECMWF

customer_reviews.title: looked like it fell down a flight of stairs -- Product ...
customer_reviews.text: Delivery: looked like it fell down a flight of stairs -- Product had the left shaft bent but I checked other reviews and they told me how to bend it back with mallet (took 2 hours). total assembly took about 6 hours. All the nuts and bolts were not included and had to go to hardware store. ($25). Product worked as described and started right up.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce J.

customer_reviews.title: Good machine
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my cabin in the mountains after doing some research on line. Worked great and we are pleased. Believe it or not the wife loves the darn thing. Not a 5 star as IMO that should be a hard thing to get. I would recommend. Couple of things though: the guard or rubber pieces in the hopper are worthless. Just get in the way. My guess lawyers made them put it there :). And the hopper arrived sorta beat up. I fixed it but clearly UPS beat it to death. I would suggest to the manufacturer to consider shipping it separate.
customer_reviews.author: michael lilly

customer_reviews.title: Worked great at first
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first, but then started to fall apart the second week. One of the bolts came loose on the knives and made a terrible noise in the tumbler and it was a difficult task to replace it, but then it had other issues with the bag tearing and the muffler breaking off of the motor. I returned it and purchased the commercial one with the 301cc viper engine. Haven't used it because of snow, so it won't be until next spring before I can see if it is any better.
customer_reviews.author: Norm Golba

customer_reviews.title: Anyways for home use this unit is fine, good price
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a 4 inch 15 hp chipper , but in California smog compliant rigs for home use are rare. This Tazz chipper has quite a bit of power for it size though. I did notice that on my unit the choke arm was mis- labeled. Pushing arm to "run" was choking and the reverse on choke. Anyways for home use this unit is fine , good price , good power.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Saito

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Chipper!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed. While the 3 inch limit prevents me from chipping everything I want, I'm still amazed at how well this machine works. I have noticed that flexible twigs (e.g. from my apple tree) do not get chipped. You do need to ensure the debris in the bag is not being blocked -- simply smack the sides of the bag a bit. Also, I found it was good to empty the bag once it was about halfway filled. I have zero complaints and I wish I had bought this sooner. I recommend having a buddy help you with the assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A Way

customer_reviews.title: Limb Eater!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing eats limbs like candy!!! I have been very satisfied with my purchase of the Tazz K32. Starts every time, chips up limbs up to 3" without any problem. Chewed up cedar limbs easy, what I consider the hardest wood to cut. Made my yard look great after turning several piles of limbs and leaves into mulch in my flowerbeds. So far, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: B Lee Thomasson Jr

customer_reviews.title: It rolls out easily to the pile of branches and pine cones in ...
customer_reviews.text: As a mature female I was a little in awe of this macho machine. It is not so scary after all. It rolls out easily to the pile of branches and pine cones in the back yard., Directions were straight and accurate and I had used a mower and gas powered pressure washer for several years with similar operations for gas and oil requirements. Very fine mulch.
customer_reviews.author: ina dehart

customer_reviews.title: Brush today, mulch tomorrow.
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of trees and shrub debris and this is one way to recycle into mulch which is useful. It took me a while to figure out how to feed safely but after that I eliminated my brush piles and made use of probably a couple hundred pounds of mulch. This unit seems very solid, easy to start and well made. A choice that I am happy with.
customer_reviews.author: ed clay

customer_reviews.title: Awesome chipper !!
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak to durability over time but out of the box this things is a "monster" It ate up and spit out long 3 inch thick limbs effortlessly. Proper feeding was key with the larger limbs but the small branches got sucked through in a nano second. True since it was brand new and the blades are sharp the machine performed perfectly with plenty of power. Time will tell as the blades get warn if the performance trails off but then you just replace or sharpen the blades.
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Puorro

customer_reviews.title: but this machine has been perfect! He took care of all the limbs and ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this after a big oak tree fell. He wasn't sure it would handle all the debris, but this machine has been perfect! He took care of all the limbs and brush in a couple of hours and we now have great mulch for the gardens. He even found the assembly quite easy and it has more than enough power to handle the large limbs he ground up
customer_reviews.author: Minxy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: The product is good and works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The product came damaged. The fuel line from switch is leaking fuel. The air filter box is broken from the back. The product is good and works as advertised, however, in spite of majority of complain about receiving damaged product has not resulted in any improvement in packaging. As this product is not usable due to damage, I will have to return and ask for either a quick replacement or a full refund. Update: I was able to purchase fuel line from local auto parts store and replaced damaged line. The machine worked amazingly well. I would give 5-Star for the Chipper. I hope the factory will send me a replacement for broken Air filter cover.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Little beast
customer_reviews.text: During shipping the shredder was slightly damaged. Nothing I couldn't fix with a rubber mallet but they should consider a better shipping crate. This thing runs like a champ and starts every pull. Helping me clear out an acre no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Estein

customer_reviews.title: Works great, chips into small pieces
customer_reviews.text: Good up to 3" diameter branches, but works better for 2.5" or less. 3" branches get chipped, but they vibrate a lot and hurt my hands as I advance it into machine. Must wear gloves when using otherwise you might tear up your hands. Smaller branches and yard debris get processed like butter. Chip size is small and looks good in the flower/vegetable gardens.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased the Tazz K32
customer_reviews.text: It was much easier to assembly than I thought. Started right up and really does a great job shredding tree limbs. I had some moments of buyer's remorse after I bought it but before I received it. Once it arrive, got it assembled and used it to shred my post winter collection of branches, I was very pleased that I had bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: For soft woods I have here like basswood and poplar
customer_reviews.text: This fits my needs exactly. Was missing one nut for assembly, had to go to hardware store. The ad says it will handle 3" wood, which is true, but if your wood is dried oak or other hardwood it DOES work, but is difficult. For soft woods I have here like basswood and poplar, it easily eats them fast. Seems to be well built, easy to assemble, motor started on first pull
customer_reviews.author: D. Kingsbury

customer_reviews.title: Assembly was tedious and the hopper was bent
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was tedious and the hopper was bent, making it even harder. Handles branches well, but leaves in hopper clog frequently. Can only handle a handful at a time and needs constant "agitation and stirring"
customer_reviews.author: Michael Beck

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: It is winter, put it together, started on first pull, and ran a couple of branches through it. Did what it was designed to do. Came with a bent axle but the company sent a new one at no cost to me. I am confident that this chipper will make good mulch from my yard debree.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Bolton

customer_reviews.title: ... with at least 50 + hours of use I recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: After 9 months and three major projects with at least 50 + hours of use I recommend this product. After sitting in my garage for a few months it was a bit difficult in getting it started. I pulled the plug and cleaned it, and that seemed to do the trick. The Tazz started right up! I like this machine, very useful around the fall and spring time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Machine - Good Value!
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good for general yard and garden clean up. Materials sometimes clogs at the neck of the shredder chute, but it's pretty easy to clear. Chipper works great. I live at 5,000 feet, so I needed a high altitude adapter. Manufacturer sent it very quickly. I am pleased with the machine overall. It's reasonably priced and the warranty is better than most other machines of the same caliber.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Cromer

customer_reviews.title: ... into the chipper (no self feed) so wear some good shock absorbing gloves or your hands will hurt
customer_reviews.text: You have to keep pressure on branches going into the chipper (no self feed) so wear some good shock absorbing gloves or your hands will hurt. It can also sometimes be a little frustrating getting stuff to feed into the shredder. But those things aside, it does a good job and handles a lot of yard waste.
customer_reviews.author: Mary E. Scofield

customer_reviews.title: Very good machine!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is very strong, reliable and easy to use! I have been using now a few hours and as long as you put the right size branches in it, it will shred with no issues. Just watch out while you shred 2-3 inches branch, the end of it might bounce back from the insert whole. Other than that, excellent tool!
customer_reviews.author: Shayetet 13

customer_reviews.title: good chipper
customer_reviews.text: Have used the chipper function several times and it made quick work on a pile of branches. Had a lot of trouble installing the damper as the hopper might have been a little bend during delivery. Damper doesn't close well, so I plan to come up with another solution when I need to use the vacuum kit
customer_reviews.author: Vic & Paula

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in perfect shape, sturdy build
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in perfect shape, sturdy build, assembled in 30 minutes with easy to follow instructions (once you got through 10 pages of warnings that I presume the lawyers insist on). Even more impressive; I filled gas and oil. Pulled the starter ONCE and the engine started right away! Used the chipper 2 hours the first day and it easily converted a pile of branches to wood chips. So, sofar very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Viking shopper

customer_reviews.title: Really nice machine.
customer_reviews.text: I really love this chipper/shredder. I was surprised about the size of the limbs that it can handle. The only problem that I can see is that it is awkward to push around the shredder and keep up with the post that holds the debris bag up. You have to hold on to this bar separately while holding on to the handle to the shredder.
customer_reviews.author: pshday

customer_reviews.title: Would love to use and rate on product but came damaged
customer_reviews.text: Would love to use and rate on product but came damaged. And now the replacement part is on back order. So it has just been sitting in my garage for almost 3 weeks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse chipper and exemplary customer service
customer_reviews.text: We recently bought a Tazz K32 for chipping branches from small trees and bushes around our new home. The machine took 60+ minutes to assemble but once put together is a work horse. The Viper engine starts reliably with one pull. Like all chippers, it requires developing a rhythm for the speed and size of feeding in branches. If feeding too fast you can hear it in the RPMs. We experienced one small problem but the company's customer service and support was exemplary. I would give the machine a high rating and their support a very high rating.
customer_reviews.author: A Mac User

customer_reviews.title: Great chipper
customer_reviews.text: Runs like a dream. Definitely chips 3 inch limbs and handles the small stuff well. Only problem has been the feeder chute cover had one of its tie downs break. I really expected it to last longer the one day of use, hence the star taken off the rating.
customer_reviews.author: Recent customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent except one item
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it five stars except the catcher basket broke at the connector on the bag upon first try. Rendering the bag totally useless. The connection ring is made out of super cheap plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tazz K32
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this machine. It arrived in perfect condition, the instructions were easy to follow for assembly. It started on the first pull and it does as it is supposed to. I am debating on the vacuum hose attachment for sucking up leafs in my flower beds but the reviews on that attachment have been very negative.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Karczewski

customer_reviews.title: Tazz performs very well handling branches 3 inches and under ...
customer_reviews.text: Tazz performs very well handling branches 3 inches and under, after I repaired the bent axel, bent hopper flange, broken air filter, apparently damaged in transit. Would have given five stars except for damage.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Watts

customer_reviews.title: A good around the house chipper shredder
customer_reviews.text: Product well packaged, with only a few marks and scuffs to the box. The instructions were missing, however located them on their website. After using it for several days, i can say I am overall satisfied with the product. Best feed 2 inch or less branches, not the recommended 3 inch. Bag can be difficult to attach. I managed to damage my chipper; parts are easily ordered online. Tolerances on replacement parts needs better quality control, as they were out of specs. I also replaced the sparkplug with a better brand. For a home shredder, should be adequate for your needs.
customer_reviews.author: MichaelBranson

customer_reviews.title: Product arrived damaged to the point of being impossible to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived with the hopper flange bent so badly that I cannot complete assembly (and thus, cannot use it). Will update after resolving issue with MFR.
customer_reviews.author: Silverstein

customer_reviews.title: Great chipper, especially for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great chipper, especially for the money. Looking at the manufacturer's specs this unit looks to be the same frame as their larger unit so this may last longer mechanically. We have a Taz cultivator too and we're impressed with both models.
customer_reviews.author: Royce Burrage Jr.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome! Turn a 4 hr job in to a ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! Turn a 4 hr job in to a 1.5hr job. Handles everything I've thrown at it all the way up to 3" thick branches. What can be annoying is the the protective rubber flap guard in the hopper, the branches will get hung up on it and doesn't feed through easily. Beside that I'm happy with it, build is very sturdy and compact, a breeze to move around. Starts on second pull.
customer_reviews.author: racered302

customer_reviews.title: Works like a beast
customer_reviews.text: Works like a beast. I have used this 5 or 6 times since purchasing and never had any issues with it starting. It rips through everything that fits through the chute. No issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: PBJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: This chipper shredder is great. Good size wood fits in the smaller chute and debris type stuff goes in the larger chute. Starts easily. Make sure you use good face protection because stuff can shoot back at you. I built my own pusher stick to shove stuff in the smaller chute.
customer_reviews.author: Michael V. Accettura

customer_reviews.title: Product has performed as advertised! This thing handles all ...
customer_reviews.text: Product has performed as advertised! This thing handles all my brush cleanup projects up to the advertised 3" diameter branches. Initial shipment had a bent axle but i called customer service and they shipped me a new one. The only negative is the position of the oil fill spout. It's nearly impossible to put oil into the engine--bad design. Overall--great product!
customer_reviews.author: Jwaddy

customer_reviews.title: I used it for the first time today and I am very happy. Some assembly required but not too bad
customer_reviews.text: This is the tool I have needed for years! I used it for the first time today and I am very happy. Some assembly required but not too bad. You need to read the schematic to figure it out. It blew through my yard waste in no time. I shredded green , dry, and wet wood. No problem at all. It was actually enjoyable
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: This is really a great machine. It starts easily and will definitely chip ...
customer_reviews.text: This is really a great machine. It starts easily and will definitely chip up to three inch branches. It also does a great jobs on leaves and wet or dry vegetation. Make sure there are no rocks!
customer_reviews.author: GregB

customer_reviews.title: Banged and bent
customer_reviews.text: Came banged up with severe bends in the top chute. Seemed to work regardless . Had to deduct one star (being generous)for showing up damaged but I understood it's a heavy item. Perhaps they can repackage the item appropriately in the future and listen to the prior reviews
customer_reviews.author: LeoCMunk

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect out of the box. After assembly, which is very easy, and adding oil this Chipper Shredder started on the very first pull and has been a workhorse since.
customer_reviews.author: Dallen

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This chipper has all the power necessary to do most yard work for a single family home. Like any chipper, the branches have to be straight, but it takes 3" branches and makes great mulch with no problems. The only complaint I have is that the plastic ring that holds the bag to the chute snapped in half the second time I used the chipper. I'm working on getting a replacement part but seems odd that it broke so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice chipper for a Chinese unit
customer_reviews.text: Product seems to work great so far. Started right up and chipped up 1" branches with ease. Outing the product together was another issue. Easy for the most part but the holes on the hopper did not align. I think this unit had been returned previously because of this as the hopper and base were bent and scratched pretty bad.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Lefever

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Works great, starts easy all the time. Its perfect to shred branches, especially when I cut my Myrtle trees I use it all the time. Be aware that the mulcher part really works only for leaves. Initial install was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Leif Ebert

customer_reviews.title: EATS A 3 INCH BRANCH LIKE BUTTER. LARGE CATCH BAG (2 BAGS FILL SMALL ...
customer_reviews.text: ONE PULL START EVERY TIME----AMAZING! EATS A 3 INCH BRANCH LIKE BUTTER. LARGE CATCH BAG (2 BAGS FILL SMALL GARDEN WHEEL BARROW) WITH SMALL CHIPS. AT 73 YR OLD I FIND THIS MACHINE IS EASY TO MOVE AND OPERATE. NO HARD KICK BACK WHEN FEEDING BRANCHES. BIG LEAF BEND ON TOP THAT EATS SMALL TWIGS. ASSEMBLY WAS GOOD USING A LITTLE TWEAKING. IF YOU NEED A CHIPPER SHREDDER YOU CANT GO WRONG WITH THE TAZZ K32.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Collins

customer_reviews.title: I would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: I mostly wanted this for the shredding of leaves, and it does a great job. I find it to be a pain to check the oil (inconvenient), and there were some problems assembling it. One place the directions were simply wrong. But once together, I'm very happy with it. Seems solidly put together, and I'm hoping it lasts for the rest of my life.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Prange

customer_reviews.title: Love my Tazz!
customer_reviews.text: Tazz is a great chipper. I was so excited when it got here! My husband and I couldn't cut up enough brush to run through it!
customer_reviews.author: Ozark mama

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart at the seams with very limited use
customer_reviews.text: With very limited use the machine is already falling apart. It started spinning (meaning it was unbalanced) and then a bolt fell off and is now completely bent where the blade is housed... very disappointed with this purchase...
customer_reviews.author: dino

customer_reviews.title: Hopper was badly damaged - POJ Warning - Steer clear of this product
customer_reviews.text: The hopper was badly damaged on this machine. But then the inner packing materials were damaged too indicated that the shipping box had been rammed or dropped. The mounting surface of the hooper that connects to the machine was twisted all the way around the opening.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A. Lang

customer_reviews.title: powerful and dependable
customer_reviews.text: It has run well for me for 12+ hours. I recommend it for brush and small (up to 3”) branches
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Chipper came pretty beat up and bent
customer_reviews.text: Chipper came pretty beat up and bent. I am handy, so with about a hour of tweaking the surface where the top loader attaches to the bottom I got her together. Works fine and they offered replacement I kept it because it was a dog to get her together and didn't want to take apart.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Pettis

customer_reviews.title: otherwise good piece once running
customer_reviews.text: this thing is crazy hard to pull start. either very heavy flywheel or too much compression on engine. about 2" branch is largest size although rated at 3". otherwise good piece once running.
customer_reviews.author: mtndog

customer_reviews.title: Razz is a beast
customer_reviews.text: Top notch machine. It can make a lot of wood chips in a short time
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bogenschutz

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this chipper
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this chipper. It works much better and is lighter than the old model it replaced. It came soon after I ordered it, and was put into service on the same day after a short assembly process.
customer_reviews.author: CR Kevo

customer_reviews.title: Looks like the rubber is no good
customer_reviews.text: Decent chipper. Chipping cap came broken. Strap to hold it missing. Looks like the rubber is no good. Update: Tazz sent replacement cover works fine now. Good for small yard debris. Mulching makes excellent fill
customer_reviews.author: Richard R.

customer_reviews.title: bit doubtful of small chippers at first.  but
customer_reviews.text: very impressed with the performance.... i normally rent the big ones from home depot... this one will do all but the rally big stuff. Wear gloves though! this thing will whip the branches back at you when it chews them up. I found that the blower output can cause chips to clog. make sure it doesnt stick. Nicely put together.
customer_reviews.author: murray j robinson

customer_reviews.title: so far, a GREAT buy!
customer_reviews.text: strong, compact and easy to use. this is only after a couple of hours run time. if anything changes i'll report back!
customer_reviews.author: Johng45

customer_reviews.title: Works very well. I just wish it had somewhere ...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. I just wish it had somewhere to store the bag support rod. I keep worrying I will scratch the paint on my car when I move it in and out of my garage.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Borabeck

customer_reviews.title: Low power, gets stuck, not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Poor placement of oil stick Power is terrible. Gets stuck all the time Doesn't fill very stable Had two of them, first was sent back because the blades exploded
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Kratz

customer_reviews.title: So far I like the machine
customer_reviews.text: So far I like the machine. Used it for about 4 hours so far with great results. My only gripe is the hopper flange that mounts to the machine was damaged. Took me about an hour to repair. This damage was not caused during shipping since this was inside of shipping container. Better inspection is needed while packing or handling at factory.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Brown

customer_reviews.title: Works just as the reviews say. No problems chewing ...
customer_reviews.text: Works just as the reviews say. No problems chewing up the tree trimming or leaves. Even came with safety goggles, a funnel, and rubber cover for the chipper. 2 inch branches no problem and we haven't even ran it at its highest speed yet. Have not tired any 3 inch stuff because we use that for firewood.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Works well. I have ten acres so it is getting a lot of use.
customer_reviews.author: EDWARD R MEYER

customer_reviews.title: Great chipper, but...
customer_reviews.text: Great chipper, but don't care for bag. Been trying to make some modifications that would be less trouble than using bag catcher. So far, no perfect solution, but still trying. I have 30 acres with lots of trees, so usually have lots to chip. For someone with occasional chipping, it is a great chipper and the bag catcher shouldn't be much of a problem.
customer_reviews.author: CAD

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: easy to put together haven't used it yet but leaf season is here.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Parent

customer_reviews.title: but it works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: a little bit of bent metal to fixs, but it works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Larry R McFarland

customer_reviews.title: This is a heavy item poorly packaged for commercial shipping and missing parts.
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy item poorly packaged for commercial shipping, and arrived with damaged edges and missing a part. I was able to cobble together a replacement for the missing part (only got 1 of 2 stud plates Part# 27077 in package), and then once I put oil and gas into the unit, it fired right up. Will update after I've pushed some yard debris through it. Update: Aside from the missing stud plate to secure the hopper to the base, have now run a couple hours' worth of branches through the chipper, and unit has performed reliably well. Easy to feed, easy to empty and replace the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Sparq

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Did not hold up very well. Had less than one year before several things started breaking. When it does up the hopper was bent and I had to bend it back into place before I could get it to for properly.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Nice Chipper, works great.
customer_reviews.text: So far it works well to help clear my yard, and son's yard of debris.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality. I use it for chipping branches and ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality. I use it for chipping branches and for shredding leaves for mulch in the fall. It is noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but it really does a good job of chipping for perfect mulch
customer_reviews.text: Hard to put together, but it really does a good job of chipping for perfect mulch.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte S. Goins

customer_reviews.title: Easy to follow instructions
customer_reviews.text: Easy to follow instructions, assemble, fill engine oil, add fuel and started 2nd 3rd pull. Worked well, We have mostly mesquite that is nasty have to pay attention to the chipping blades.
customer_reviews.author: david weeks

customer_reviews.title: This item developed several problems with use. The muffer ...
customer_reviews.text: This item developed several problems with use. The muffer blew right off. The throttle level fell away. The hopper developed a crack. The wheel came away at the welded joint. The bag developed a 6" hole. Numerous bolts have shaken themselves loose. I've contacted the manufacturer and they sent me to an authorized repairer, who refused to repair it due to the share number of problems. Then I had to pick it up and travel all across town to another repairer. I'm waiting to see if the item is repaired or replaced,
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed--My New Favorite Gadget
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for less than a month and have used it extensively for fall clean up. I am very impressed by this chipper/shredder. It starts without issue on the first pull and runs like champ--regardless of the debris that I feed it. It reduces a full garbage can of leaves into a small pile. I have fed it limbs and grasses as well. It's a solid performer. Best of all, all the lawn and garden waste that I was sending the landfill is now being used around my garden beds. I am a tool and gadget guy. This is, arguably, my favorite tool to use. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: LAW

product_meta.title: Tazz 18493 K32 Heavy Duty 212cc Gas Powered 4 Cycle Viper Engine 3:1 Capable Multi-Function Wood Chipper Shredder 3" Max Wood Diameter Capacity, 5 Year Warranty
product_meta.description: The K32 Tazi Chipper Shredder offers incredible performance in a surprisingly compact package. The unit is powered by an easy-starting and powerful Viper engine, strong enough to chip branches up to 3" in diameter. The rugged steel hopper stands at only 34" high, so yard waste can be dropped in with minimal effort while larger branches can be fed into the limb chute. If desired, mulch can be collected in the included debris bag. The grinding chamber features heavy-duty knives and hammers that will reduce material down to 1/20th of its original volume. Each model has been tested to and surpassed, ANSI B71.6 safety standards. Experience the efficient power of Tazi Chipper Shredders today.
feature_bullets: Optional vacuum kit featuring a unique air gate and largest-in-class rotor, Tazz produces 20% more vacuum than similar chipper shredders
At a convenient 25.4" wide by 29.9" long, it takes up minimal room in your garage or shed.
Always-ready, 11" wheels will never go flat. ENGINE TORQUE : 8.86 FT-LB GROSS TORQUE
Rugged easy-to-use debris bag featuring the Bottom-Out zipper and a quick Dock-and-Lock bag connector

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars254 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
